result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Jacob Harter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Phillip Jacob Harter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Phillip Jacob Harter was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

Absolute sobriety.
No contact with any bar or tavern.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropraite by PO and undergo testing at any time for such.
Be in full compliance with any family court order regarding contact with victims. 
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work, treatment, counseling, AA, & NA if defendant qualifies.To be served within 20 days at discretion of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Jacob Harter

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:13am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant does not appear - Atty Rick Cveykus appears on his behalf
(Motion to Modify Probation)

COURT has reviewed request for Motion to Modify Probation.
State does not object - COURT accepts stipulation.
Atty Cveykus to draft order.

Independant Assessment Services
Sentencing Recommendation-SEALED

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:32pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Rick Cveykus.

COURT notes PSI completed and alternative PSI completed - COURT has reviewed both, along with victim impact statement, and various letters sent to court on behalf of defendant.
Atty Cveykus notes corrections to PSI.

Justin Rooney (Independent Assessment Services) sworn and testifies.

Argument by State on sentencing recommendation.
Argument by Attorney Cveykus on sentencing recommendation.
COURT makes findings.

COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Reckless Endanger Safety)>> 6 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES, I&S; 4 years Probation

CONDITIONS of ES: 9 months MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/counseling/AA and NA if defendant qualifies under jail classification system w/credit for 40 days of credit, with balance of sentence to be served within 20 days at discretion of PO;  Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO and undergo testing at any time for such; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or a combination thereof; No contact with any bar or tavern; Absolute sobriety; Defendant to be in full compliance with any family court order regarding contact with victims; CC; DNA sample and surcharge; Restitution of $458 to Wausau Fire Department.

Defendant IS NOT eligible for both CIP and SAP.
Defendant to report to probation dept immediately.

COURT reminds counsel re: retaining confidentiality of PSI and alternative PSI.

Adj: 3:40pm
with report from ATTIC

Clerk Cheree

COURT amends bond to $1000 cash bond w/all conditions established on 7/2/14

State also moves to Dismiss Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 and requests Court find those in best interest of public; 
COURT finds State meets burden to dismiss Cts 2 and 3 and COURT dismisses Cts 2 and 3


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (2nd Deg Reckless Endangerment)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty.
Sentencing hearing already set for 3/1/16 at 1:30pm
Bond continues.

Case called:  10:10 am
Clerk:  Kim

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo
Defendant appears w/Atty Rick Cveykus

Date and time set for Motion Hearing to Modify Bond.  State informs Court motion is filed by defendant, and there are letters in file from two doctors stating he is unable to care for himself.  Defendant is requesting to remove condition of day report and to allow him to move to 3261 Baltimore St., North Port, FL  34286.  Atty Cveykus makes argument stating AODA treatment to be continued in Florida, requests to have phone with his children while in Florida, and to have supervised contact with contact w/adult 25 years or older.  Atty Cveykus states he will be back here for Preliminary Haering.  Discovery not yet complete.  State takes no position.  State requests defendant to sign release for testing results done in Florida.  

COURT allows bond to be modified >> defendant may reside in Florida w/father, phone contact w/children while in Florida, in Marathon Co. supervised contact w/adult 25 years or older, and sign release for State to have access of treatment/therapy records. 

Parties to set PTC right after court.  COURT releases defendant from day report while in Florida.

Shall not drive a motor vehicle whatsoever.  No alcohol.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or beer tents.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report Program - within 1 business day.  No contact with victim(s):  L.V.C. (DOB 11-14-02) and N.G.H. (DOB 1-25-06) except under conditions authorized by Department of Social Services.
